alert.note: Alert for City of Newport News; City of Williamsburg; Gloucester; James City; King and Queen; Mathews; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 8:40PM EST until January 09 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EST FOR GLOUCESTER...SOUTHEASTERN KING AND QUEEN...YORK...WESTERN MATHEWS...JAMES CITY...AND NORTHEASTERN SURRY COUNTIES...THE NORTHERN CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG... At 840 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Shacklefords to 7 miles southeast of Surry, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Newport News, Williamsburg, Gloucester Courthouse, Queens Lake, Grove, Kings Point, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Glenns, and Busch Gardens around 845 PM EST. Gloucester Point, Lee Hall, Hayes, and Wicomico around 850 PM EST. Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences around 855 PM EST. Achilles around 900 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Croaker, Lackey, Chippokes State Park, Beulah, Camp Peary, Naxera, Ewell, Poolesville, Allmondsville, and Fort Nonsense. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for southeastern and east central Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: City of Newport News; City of Williamsburg; Gloucester; James City; King and Queen; Mathews; Surry; York
